intro: Modiola multifida, commonly known as the narrow-leafed mallow, is a perennial herb native to southern Africa. It features slender, upright stems that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, pale pink to white flowers that bloom in clusters during the cooler months. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a distinctive, slightly serrated edge. Modiola multifida is adapted to arid environments and is often found in rocky or sandy soils.
